newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish fighter crashes, two pilots eject safely.
newsitem.headline: Turkish fighter crashes, two pilots eject safely.

text.p: A Turkish fighter plane crashed on Tuesday during a training flight in southeast Turkey and the two pilots ejected safely, military officials said.
The F-4 crashed at around 9:45 a.m. (0745 GMT) in Batman province.
"The two pilots ejected and they are alright," an army major told Reuters by telephone from the city of Diyarbakir, administrative centre of the southeast.
He said the two pilots were taken to hospital but did not specify any injuries. Earlier, Anatolian news agency said the two had been injured.
"There was most probably a technical fault," the military official said.
